intro: Rusbyella suarezii, commonly known as the Suarez's Rusbyella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and has delicate, hairy leaves. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
